story_prompt: Humanity is visited by a cosmic horror the likes of which has only been seen in Lovecraftian horror. In desperation, Earth throws everything we have at it, and, miraculously, the human race has killed a God. Somewhere in a realm beyond our understanding, the other gods speak of the event.
characters:
Characters: 
1. A brilliant but troubled scientist who is instrumental in developing the weapon that kills the cosmic horror, but struggles with the weight of the world on his shoulders after the event. 
2. A hardened warrior who volunteers for the final battle against the horror, but grapples with the loss of friends and comrades during the fight. 
3. A charismatic religious leader who becomes a symbol of hope for humanity after the event, but secretly harbors deep fears about the true nature of the universe. 

The story explores their personal struggles and how they cope with survivor guilt, trauma, and existential dread.

System: The story will be told through the lens of these three characters, each with their own unique perspective on the events that transpired. The player will be able to control each character and make choices that impact the narrative and ultimately decide the fate of humanity. The game will be a blend of interactive storytelling and role-playing elements, with puzzles and mini-games to solve. The ultimate goal is to uncover the truth behind the cosmic horror and the true nature of the universe.
output:
In the wake of the apocalypse, the world was shrouded in an eerie silence. The remnants of humanity huddled together, waiting for the other shoe to drop. The brilliant but troubled scientist, Dr. Thompson, had been instrumental in developing the weapon that killed the cosmic horror. But the weight of the world on his shoulders was crushing him. He had lost countless colleagues and friends in the fight, and the trauma of it all was beginning to take its toll.

The hardened warrior, Captain Rodriguez, had volunteered for the final battle against the horror. She had lost many comrades and was grappling with the loss of her own humanity in the face of such unspeakable evil. She had always been a pillar of strength for her fellow soldiers, but now she felt vulnerable and alone.

The charismatic religious leader, Father Martin, had become a symbol of hope for humanity after the event. His words of comfort and strength had given people the will to carry on. But he harbored deep fears about the true nature of the universe. He had always believed that there was a higher power watching over humanity, but now he wondered if such a being even existed. He struggled with the idea that maybe humanity was truly alone in the universe, and that the cosmic horror was just the beginning of something much darker.

As the survivors began to rebuild their lives, they knew that they would never be the same again. They had been changed by the horror, and by the sacrifices they had made to defeat it. But as they looked up at the stars, they couldn't help but wonder what other terrors lay waiting in the vast expanse of space. And so, they continued to fight, not just for their own survival, but for the future of humanity itself.
